events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the morning of May 1st involving two cars at a busy intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under 'Auto Accident' following the initial report of the vehicular collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the customer's case to facilitate the claim process and coordinate further steps.
The claim has been officially acknowledged, and the customer received confirmation that the process is underway.
The insurer requested the submission of photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates for assessment.
The customer promptly provided all requested documents including detailed photos, the official police report, and mechanic's estimate.
The investigation into the accident circumstances began to verify the claim accuracy and assess liability based on all evidence.
The investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and damages to the vehicle align with the reported incident.
A settlement offer was proposed covering repair costs and a rental vehicle for the estimated downtime period.
The customer accepted the proposed settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the speed and clarity of the process.
Claim approval was granted following customer agreement to the settlement terms, enabling payment processing.
Payment for vehicle repairs and rental reimbursement was issued promptly to the customer's designated bank account.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that all payments were received and the customer was fully satisfied.
All claim documents and communications have been archived in the insurance system for future reference and compliance.
